column1: Hippy tried to recall what had happened to him. He remembered riding along the trail; remembered the good-natured teasing of the Overland girls
column2: then all at once consciousness was blotted out. He had a faint recollection of being jolted
column3: which probably was when he was being carried away on a horse
column4: but that was the extent of his recollections. He did know that his head hurt him terribly and that it felt twice its natural size. His throat was parched from thirst
column5: but Lieutenant Wingate declared to himself that he would die rather than ask a favor of the ruffian there who was guarding him.Shortly after dark Hippy heard voices outside the cave; then two men came in
column6: jerked him to his feet and
column8: threw him over the back of a pony just ahead of the saddle
column9: as if he were a bag of meal. When the rider mounted
column10: Hippy was placed right side up on the saddle
column11: his companion sitting behind him on the horse's back.
